sentences.english: I’ve been in that situation lately.
sentences.chinese: 我不久前也曾身陷這樣的處境。

sentences.english: The results will be reported in scientific journals in the near future" , said Dr Vallotton."
sentences.chinese: 不久的將來，其結果將會發表在學術刊物上。

sentences.english: He had cleared them out three years ago but they had all come back in again.
sentences.chinese: 祂三年前曾經把他們趕出去，但不久又回覆舊觀。

sentences.english: Shortly afterward, the Anyuanding executives were detained.
sentences.chinese: 不久之後，安元鼎主管被拘留。

sentences.english: Humour in the ads is a recent innovation, but parodies of them are plentiful.
sentences.chinese: 廣告中幽默這一創新出現不久，卻被到處效顰。

sentences.english: He's getting along hand over hand; he'll soon be convalescent.
sentences.chinese: 他的情況逐步有了起色，不久就會康復的。

sentences.english: An alliance with likeminded Red Talons may not be long in coming.
sentences.chinese: 有差不多意圖的聯盟部族比如紅爪不久也會這麼想。

sentences.english: The price of sugar will drop soon.
Later came the first break in their restored home circle. The Dovecote
sentences.chinese: 不久，他們重新團聚起來的家就發生了第一次突破。

sentences.english: Pangu open days soon, then, heaven and the earth is almost connected.
sentences.chinese: 盤古開天不久，那時，天和地差不多連着。

sentences.english: Director Zhang solved an intricate case soon after he took his post.
sentences.chinese: 局長剛上任不久就將一件無頭案偵破了。

sentences.english: Chinese State Councilor Ma Kai has recently concluded his visit to the EU headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 不久前，馬凱國務委員成功訪問歐盟總部。

sentences.english: He moved to northern New Mexico shortly after graduating in 1969.
sentences.chinese: 1969年畢業後不久，他搬到新墨西哥州北部。

sentences.english: It won't be long before the cross-river bridge is completed.
sentences.chinese: 不久之後新的跨江大橋就竣工了。

sentences.english: Before long, along came this little old man.
sentences.chinese: 過了不久，沿路來了一個小老頭。

definition: a good thing doesn't last forever (idiom)
to be just about to/to have just started to
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
